docs.snippet: Holiday Treats   Rosh ha-Shanah, the Jewish New Year, begins at sundown on Sept. 8. Though Mama or Grandma prepared the whole meal in years past, these days professional bakers and caterers often help out the family cook. Some professionals even u...
docs.lead_paragraph: Holiday Treats Rosh ha-Shanah, the Jewish New Year, begins at sundown on Sept. 8. Though Mama or Grandma prepared the whole meal in years past, these days professional bakers and caterers often help out the family cook. Some professionals even use recipes that belonged to their mothers and grandmothers.

headline.main: Food Flows, Along With Drinks, at Ninth Avenue Festival

docs.snippet: To the Editor:    Frank Rich's piece on the Mighty Mo (''More Than Just a Burger,'' Oct. 6) and all it signified of youth, family, longing and growing up was a classic. It brought tears to my eyes at the breakfast table. I got all the makings and ...
docs.abstract: Ben Stein letter on Frank Rich's Oct 6 article on his childhood food memories
docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Frank Rich's piece on the Mighty Mo (''More Than Just a Burger,'' Oct. 6) and all it signified of youth, family, longing and growing up was a classic. It brought tears to my eyes at the breakfast table. I got all the makings and made them for my family that very night. They were delicious, but at the end of the meal I was still an overweight middle-aged man and not a teen-ager in Silver Spring, Md., at the Hot Shoppes. BEN STEIN Malibu, Calif.

docs.snippet: Perhaps the food pantries and people serving the hungry, as mentioned in ''The Many Faces of Hunger'' on March 14, could get a van or two and a storage place with refrigeration. That way workers could pick up day-old deli, dairy, produce, bakery a...
docs.abstract: Susan Gabriele letter in response to March 14 suggests that supermarkets donate day-old or otherwise unsaleable food to organizations and people serving hungry in Westchester County, NY (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: Perhaps the food pantries and people serving the hungry, as mentioned in ''The Many Faces of Hunger'' on March 14, could get a van or two and a storage place with refrigeration. That way workers could pick up day-old deli, dairy, produce, bakery and bread products Monday through Friday and take them to a storage place. Later that day, the food could be distributed to families in a community meeting place. A similar program called LIFE (Love Is Feeding Everyone) has worked in Los Angeles and some other large cities.

headline.main: A Suggestion for Using Quantities of Day-Old Food

docs.snippet: THE room is a vision of pristine stainless-steel surfaces, sealed off from the rest of the world -- and its bacteria -- by thick sheets of plastic. Every worker wears a white hospital coat, every hand is tucked inside a rubber glove, every breath ...
docs.abstract: Clean rooms common to surgical wards and computer-chip plants, are currently in place at handful of food companies that regard production of refrigerated, ready-made dinners as wave of future and clean rooms as way to keep highly perishable foods from spoiling; photo (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: THE room is a vision of pristine stainless-steel surfaces, sealed off from the rest of the world -- and its bacteria -- by thick sheets of plastic. Every worker wears a white hospital coat, every hand is tucked inside a rubber glove, every breath of air is filtered. All in the name of making ravioli.

docs.snippet: The idea for this dish came from a recipe for pizzocheri, the Italian buckwheat pasta, with vegetables.     But it is easier to find the Japanese soba noodles used here than pizzocheri....
docs.abstract: Marian Burros offers recipe for buckwheat noodles and vegetables; recipes (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: The idea for this dish came from a recipe for pizzocheri, the Italian buckwheat pasta, with vegetables. But it is easier to find the Japanese soba noodles used here than pizzocheri.

headline.main: For Holiday Leftovers, Noodles to the Rescue

docs.snippet: Your paean to America's eating habits failed to mention the predilection among Middle Westerners for salads in which the only green ingredient is lime Jell-O or the Granny Smith apples in my mother-in-law's Snickers salad. That's right! Snickers s...
docs.lead_paragraph: Your paean to America's eating habits failed to mention the predilection among Middle Westerners for salads in which the only green ingredient is lime Jell-O or the Granny Smith apples in my mother-in-law's Snickers salad. That's right! Snickers salad -- a concoction of Granny Smith apples, Snickers bars and Cool Whip.
